page.title: 07Quantock Hills
page.content: We struggled up an everlasting greeting road to a humbled corner shadowed over by terrific hung down grappling. Trumps of silent cattle passing by through a grazing field of lambs. A sharp headed barb wire with a rotting gate and a slip of trees with leading down path with a bog at the sides at a silent farm. Down a country lane and steep hill going down nearly breaking each bone in our body and we came to a park. First we sat down playing sardines and listening to Colonel Stokes about the nature around us. We were on our way, led by a silent stream feeling hot and damp as well. Robin Taylor (Aged 9)
